basics.name: ZHOU, YANUO (Arnold)
basics.label: Research Scientist & ML Engineer
basics.summary: MSc in Precision Health and Medicine (NUS) with expertise in machine learning, biomarker discovery, wearable signal processing, and reproducible ML pipelines. Focused on building audit-ready workflows for biomedical applications.

work.name: TUM-CREATE (NRF Singapore research centre, collaborating with TUM, NUS and NTU)
work.summary: Developing reproducible ML pipelines for wearable spectral data analysis with focus on circadian health digital phenotyping.
highlights: Multi-sensor fusion and feature engineering for wearable spectral data
Circadian health digital phenotyping and biomarker discovery
Reproducible ML pipelines with audit-ready workflows
Supervisor: Prof. Dr. Manuel Spitschan (Technical University of Munich)

work.name: National University of Singapore (NUS), Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine
work.summary: Machine Learning-Based Biomarker Discovery for Suicide Risk in Depression using RNA-seq data.
highlights: Psychiatric biomarker discovery using RNA-seq and imbalanced learning
Cross-cohort validation and reproducible ML workflows
Pathway-based interpretation and clinical relevance analysis
Supervisor: A/Prof. Caroline Lee (Vice Dean & Programme Director, NUS Graduate School)

work.name: Key Laboratory of Non-Destructive Testing, Ministry of Education, China
work.summary: Diverse research projects spanning wearable sensors, signal processing, and medical imaging.
highlights: Wearable optical sweat analytics with microfluidics and colourimetry
ECG & EEG real-time signal detection systems
Signal processing, computer vision, and embedded systems development

work.name: SEECEN TECHNOLOGY CO., LTD.
work.summary: Front-end web development with focus on cross-browser compatibility.
highlights: Front-end web development and cross-browser compatibility

awards.title: Precision Health & Medicine Scholarship (PRECISE, Singapore)
awards.summary: Competitive scholarship for MSc program in Precision Health and Medicine

awards.title: Third Prize, 10th National Student Optoelectronic Design Competition
awards.awarder: China National Student Optoelectronic Design Competition
awards.summary: Awarded for Wearable Optical Sweat Analytics project

awards.title: Second Prize, 8th National Student Optoelectronic Design Competition
awards.awarder: China National Student Optoelectronic Design Competition
awards.summary: Awarded for Intelligent Tunnel Multi-Parameter Monitoring System project

awards.title: Silver Award, 12th "Challenge Cup" Jiangxi Student Entrepreneurship Competition

publications.name: Wearable tesla valve-based sweat collection device for sweat colorimetric analysis
publications.summary: Huanhuan Shi, Yu Cao, Yining Zeng, Yanuo Zhou, et al. Peer-reviewed, high-impact journal publication on wearable sweat analytics technology.

publications.name: Development and Application of Microfluidic Concentration Gradient Chip
publications.summary: Shi, H., Cao, Y., Zhou, Y., et al. Publication on microfluidic device development for drug susceptibility analysis.

skills.name: Machine Learning & Data Science
keywords: SVM, GBM, XGBoost, Logistic Regression, Random Forest
Participant-wise 5-fold CV, stratified CV, Bayesian optimization
SMOTE-Tomek, balanced class weights for imbalanced learning

skills.name: Feature Engineering & Wearable Pipelines
keywords: Behavioral feature extraction (GPS, app usage, communication patterns)

skills.name: Signal Processing & Computer Vision
keywords: Mean IoU, pixel accuracy, precision/recall metrics

references.name: Prof Dr Manuel Spitschan
references.reference: Current TUM-CREATE supervisor. Guided wearable spectral data analysis and circadian health research.

references.name: A/Prof Caroline Lee
references.reference: NUS course supervisor. Supervised RNA-seq biomarker discovery for psychiatric applications.

references.name: Prof Zhang Weiwei
references.reference: Undergraduate research supervisor. Led Intelligent Tunnel Monitoring and Wearable Cortisol Detection projects.

references.name: A/Prof Shi Huanhuan
references.reference: Undergraduate research supervisor. Co-authored Talanta Q1 paper on sweat analytics; supervised National Innovation Project.

references.name: Prof Jiang Shaofeng
references.reference: Undergraduate mentor. Observed academic growth over 4 years; endorsed for PhD in biomedical engineering.

projects.name: AI-Driven Light Exposure Classification
projects.summary: ML framework for circadian health phenotyping from wearable sensors. MSc Capstone project achieving 88.1% accuracy (AUC 0.938) in distinguishing natural from artificial light.
highlights: 88.1% accuracy (AUC 0.938) for natural vs. artificial light classification
Spectral shape prioritization over absolute intensity
Reproducible pipeline with fixed seeds and environment hashes
Transparent negative evidence reporting (PCA, SMOTE-Tomek limitations)

projects.name: Machine Learning Biomarkers for Suicide Risk Assessment in Depression
projects.summary: Course-based research identifying psychiatric biomarkers (NR3C1a, HSPA1B) from RNA-seq with cross-cohort validation and imbalanced learning.
highlights: NR3C1a, HSPA1B as top biomarkers for suicide risk in depression
4-class to binary mapping for clinical relevance
Reproducible ML workflow with audit-ready artifacts

projects.name: Multimodal Depression Detection via Smartphone Sensing
projects.summary: Research-stage ML pipeline for depression biomarker discovery using passive smartphone sensor data from StudentLife dataset (46 college students).
highlights: 50 features across 4 modalities: GPS, app usage, communication, physical activity
Top biomarker: app usage diversity variability (reflects anhedonia)
Identified and corrected data leakage for robust evaluation
Stratified 5-fold CV with balanced class weights for severe imbalance (4:42)
Apple Silicon MPS acceleration for deep learning models

projects.name: PrimeKG-RGCN Drug-Disease Link Prediction
projects.summary: Graph neural networks for computational drug discovery. Independent research with Phase 1 optimization achieving significant performance improvements.
highlights: 88% reduction in mean rank (493.53 → 58.75), 75× evaluation speedup
Architecture: LayerNorm, skip connections, embedding caching, vectorized ops
RGCN on 30,926 nodes (6,282 drugs, 5,593 diseases, 19,051 genes), 849,456 edges

projects.name: Wearable Optical Sweat Analytics
projects.summary: Microfluidics and RGB colorimetry for biomarker detection. National innovation project with Talanta publication and competition awards.
highlights: 3rd Prize (10th National Student Optoelectronic Design Competition, 2022)
Funded by Outstanding Young Scientist Project (20192BCB23011)

projects.name: Android Sleep Quality Monitoring System
projects.summary: BEng thesis achieving 80% accurate sleep quality monitoring using phone sensors with volunteer validation. No external devices required.

projects.name: Multi-Parameter Physiological Monitoring System
projects.summary: Real-time monitoring of ECG, SpO2, respiration, temperature, and blood pressure with Qt/QML desktop and web interfaces.

projects.name: U-Net for Skin Lesion Segmentation
projects.summary: Complete implementation with LabelMe annotation, model training, validation, and PyQt5 GUI for dermatological image analysis.

projects.name: Fluorescence-Based Fire Safety Monitoring System
projects.summary: Smart monitoring system using fluorescence sensing for temperature, humidity, and fire detection in buildings and tunnels.
highlights: Silver Award (12th 'Challenge Cup' Jiangxi Student Entrepreneurship, 2020)
2nd Prize (8th National Student Optoelectronic Design Competition, 2020)

projects.name: Microfluidic Concentration Gradient Chip for Drug Susceptibility
projects.summary: Dean vortex secondary flow mixing for high-throughput biochemical applications. 2 patents and journal publication.
highlights: Published in Chinese Journal of Medical Physics (2021)
Funded by PhD Research Startup Fund (EA202008205)

projects.name: Thermal Cycling Device for Fluorescence Quantitative PCR
projects.summary: Research project on thermal cycling system design for qPCR instrumentation with precision temperature control.
highlights: Successful Participant (2021 National Undergraduate BME Innovation Design Competition)

projects.name: Quantitative Investment Strategies in Cryptocurrency Markets
projects.summary: Research on profitability of different investment strategies in cryptocurrency trading with backtesting and risk analysis.
